title: Bye Soraka

replies.body:
As has been pointed out elsewhere, it's (that is, Alignment and the new Starcall) a decent mechanic for getting her to care about landing Starcall more (and not just grabbing Warmog's and parking in the way-backline), but it has some tuning and scaling issues.

If they made it stack in intensity - say by generating one five-second Alignment buff for every enemy champion hit with Starcall - she'd be far more viable in teamfights, and would have even more reason to stay in combat in order to throw that delicious mana and health-over-time (proccing Windspeaker's, remember) around.

I see two huge problems with this rework:

1.) Tying in her self-heal and ally heal. This makes it very tricky to balance, as her self heal being strong means that her ally heal will probably be insane; conversely, if it's kept low Soraka will be useless without a way to recover HP she pays for her heals, which bring us to:

2.) These changes in their current state make grabbing Warmogs and parking in the backline the only viable choice - highly ironical considering how these changes were probably aimed at making her more interactive; tho it certainly isn't the first time Riot completely fucks up and end us with the opposite of what they are trying to accomplish (remember first round of Lucian "nerfs" which brought him to perma pick/ban and earned him the nickname "Black Kassadin"?). Soraka needs a way to constantly recover her HP or she is useless - and if her self heal isn't fit for the job Warmog is the only solution.

Again, they might buff it around, but considering the point number one, I highly doubt that. And sadly I believe we'll have another pre-rework Eve with that - useless troll pick (yes, some people were banned for playing old Eve - it was that bad) until the eventual rework comes somewhere around season 19.

A stacking Alingment could be a solution to that.

If she hits several opponents, she got a strong self heal, but if Astral Infusion transfers only one stack at a time her Ally heal won't be overbearing.

>If they made it stack in intensity - say by generating one five-second Alignment buff for every enemy champion hit with Starcall - she'd be far more viable in teamfights, 

That's actually not correct. She's going to be much, much worse in teamfights than live Soraka even if she gets a stack for every enemy she hits. There are a few reasons for this. First, and most importantly, she can't self-heal with it in teamfights. It has a duration of 5 seconds, and W with max CDR has a cooldown of 1.2 seconds. Given that each stack of alignment is significantly weaker than an individual proc of W, you're completely prevented from keeping the buff up on yourself. You barely get 1/5 of the duration from alignment on yourself.

That's the huge problem with Alignment. The long duration of alignment compared to the short cooldown of her W makes it impossible for her to use it to self-heal in teamfights without completely stopping, which actually massively dememphasizes the Q. I'm not going to self-heal whether I land the Q or not, and it heals slowly enough and for little enough that it can't save an ally, so I'm not punished for missing it. That's all I've been from people who have played her on the PBE. Q barely matters past the laning phase anymore, and alignment is the reason.

A 5 second duration alignment can't coexist with a 2 - 1.2 second CD W. They just conflict with each other way too much.

>and would have even more reason to stay in combat in order to throw that delicious mana and health-over-time

Again, that's just wrong. The thing that incentivizes me to stay around in combat is self-heals, and alignment guts those. If I can't heal enough to cast my W, then I can't stick around in a fight. Additionally, even with alignment you actually heal an ally for less than you would heal them on live. At best, you can get alignment on every second W in a teamfight (assuming you never miss Q), and it heals for 90(+0.1). W was nerfed to heal for 50 less at all levels, so you lose 100 upfront for 90(+nothing) over 5 seconds. Even in the absolutely ideal situation, it's not better.
It's more about spreading Alignment to all members of the team, as oppose to focus only on the adc.

Numerically not worth it, and unrealistic in terms of gameplay. Alignment heals for very little and actively spreading it around does not significantly increase your team's survival, particularly when compared with the base healing she lost. 

In addition, people do not take damage equally in a teamfight, and you always end up having to focus heals on the player most at risk of dying. A fight where you can afford to waste time spread alignment to everyone is a fight you were guarenteed to win without it if you focused your heals better.

Actively trying to spread it around sucks. It will make you lose fights you could have won.

You know what really wins fights for Soraka? Self-healing so she can throw out more total heals. You know what happens when she keeps having to give up alignment to ber teammates? She heals much less in total, and dies much easier.

I never said it wasn't a nerf, it sure is, but spreading the alignment will still yield significant healing.

If this change goes through, the playstyle will be more about managing the HP of the entire team, rather than a hotfix when someone messes up.

>the playstyle will be more about managing the HP of the entire team

Nope. No chance. Trying to manage the hp of an entire team isn't something that she'll be able to do. It's still waaaaay worse than burst healing a single person. There are multiple reasons for this.

First, your ability to manage the health of multiple people is determined primarily by your self healing, because you need that to keep casting W across multiple people. Your self-healing has been majorly, absolutely nerfed, not only because the numbers on alignment are just weaker than the current one even in alignment's ideal situation, but also because you can't keep alignment on yourself while healing (and because the numbers are just way worse). Your ability to provide health to multiple people to a dergree that actually keeps them safe has been massively nerfed by this. Burst-healing someone doesn't rely on this statistic as much because it takes fewer raw heals to save one person than it takes to try and keep an entire team healthy. So, the most-nerfed aspect of her kit is also the aspect she would have needed to successfully keep multiple people healed.

Second, the dynamics of the game don't allow you to try to manage a team's health successfully in any equal fight. If you're in a situation where you and your team are hitting someone, you can't afford to try to spread healing around because you expose your allies to being bursted down. Healing the person most at risk of dying is much more effective. 

You just have to remember one thing when thinking about the Soraka rework. Remember that alignment sucks. If you remember that, you'll be able to figure out everything you need to know about her new playstyle. Does a playstyle rely on alignment not sucking? If so, it's going to be a bad playstyle. Does the playstyle work regardless of whether or not alignment is good? That's probably the playstyle we'll all adopt.

Seriously though, I know it looks not-terrible on paper, but when you actually get the chance to play it and you realize just how much the health-managing playstyle relied on the strength of the self-heal and how much it doesn't work if you have to wait 5 full seconds to regen before you can pass more health around, then you see just how much that playstyle won't work. It's just plain worse than the alternatives.
spending 20 seconds and 300 mana to put a lackluster HoT on 5 people? Sounds fun right?

> Alignment and the new Starcall) a decent mechanic for getting her to care about landing Starcall more

Not sure how you figure. Right now, Soraka gets more health back if she lands a Starcall on multiple champions. With the changes, hitting all five members of the enemy team or hitting one will have the exact same effect, her getting the "Alignment" buff.

Unless I'm missing something, there's absolutely no reason to try and hit two people with the new Starcall, meaning Soraka will just stay safer than on live.

Because she'll be able to offer more to her team if she lands it.

You're right in that the alignment buff needs some fixes - having it stack with the number of targets hit would do wonderfully - but being able to pass that buff off to an ally grants a lot of secondary effects depending on how it's implemented.

If they implement it as healing over time instead of regeneration (which is what it looks like on the video) then it'll trigger Windspeaker's and Ardent Censer. Transferring Alignment to your carry then grants them an armor and MR boost for 8 seconds, along with an AS and on-hit damage boost for 11 seconds. To me, that's definitely worth landing a Q.
Did we have the exact same idea or did you see my posts? lol.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bT90D0GKZRM

In all honesty as a level 5 soraka player, this looks like buffs compared to her Q range nerf.

Now we get life and mana replenished on Q, which means solo raka is a little more viable and it transfers to the allie when I heal? Thanks you just made up for the shitty Q range nerfs.

Keep on trying riot, it's not gonna stop her being viable.

As a level 5 Soraka player, with 820+ games last season, top 3 picks every season for 5 years, no, these are not buffs. Her self-sustain will be nearly non-existent as she'll constantly give it up to her allies and find herself dwindling and struggling to stay alive. It no longer affects per champion struck, so she's stuck with a 90 heal over 5 seconds at all times. With a 10% AP ratio over 5 seconds, not per second, 200 ap will only provide 20 extra healing.

Which you'll most likely just give up regardless, trying to keep an ally alive with a shitty 170 heal at max rank that will never compare to live's values unless you let the hot tick over refreshing it, losing out on extra healing, by healing the ally over and over again as you should to keep them alive. Starcall no longer does extra damage for hitting the center, so solo Soraka is out of the question. Even if you do max it, you're going to have to depend on hitting one champion with its smaller radius coupled with its medium range, and just wait out the 5 seconds which is a lot in mobas.

These changes will ***literally*** make Soraka unviable for a long time, as she'll be more of a detrimental handicap to her team than a helping factor.

As a level 5 soraka these are not buff's but just a murder
To think I was almost considering playing the game again. Not with those changes~

Another level 5 raka player here, alignment isn't a terrible idea, but it needs work. The AP ratios are too low and restoring mana to other champs is a bad idea due to how it completely goes against riot's choice to remove mana pots. 

Honestly, I think it should be like this: She hits starcall and receives 10 - 40% AP + some base health and a bit of mana with a base above her starcall cost. This is healed over 5 - 10 seconds and stacks infinitely (but it's very hard to get past a large number). If she heals her target, they receive a heal as powerful as this patch would be balanced around or a bit less (60% AP I think), and 1/2 - 2x of a starcall heal but not mana is transferred instantly if present. She's encouraged to hit Qs regardless of what she does, but she also has this storage of extra powered heals which give her sustain but she has to give up not only her health, but her sustain to heal others.

In exchange of having more powerful W heals, she no longer has a safe Q heal unless she backs off from her ADC.

Her playstyle would change from Q W W Q W W with careful health management and team health bar awareness to having to consider whether each W is safe while having to be extremely greedy with her Q hits and use it whenever it's off cooldown as they heal is as important as Cassiopeia getting passive stacks from her Q poison on champs.
damn those w changes are rough.

I main Soraka.  I will miss using heal to try to deny creeps, and to troll adc positioning to get free Qs.  Detuning the heal further is sad it's her primary contribution to the team.

She's been nerfed so hard already and the rework was already nerfs.. She is OP because W is on a low cool down and it abuses the new mastery and ardent sensor.  How about putting it on a realistic and intended cool down like all the heals and shields in the game so it doesn't super scale with keystone and ardent sensor then give it some real scales, this would make deciding when to use it the interesting decision.

One small voice, please don't break my main, or you aren't getting my money.
{{item:3083}} tank Soraka will still be the most OP support even after these changes, I garentee it

I wouldn't care that much if it had some nice scaling or something added to it.

But a glorified heal over time? Good luck healing anything with grevious wounds. This is basically a reverse version of Twitch's passive, if only it was really, really bad. And the fact that it gives mana won't save it. That's why she built the way she built in the first place.

Oh, and her new Q is bland, fucking dumb, boring, and devoid of any interesting gameplay interaction, even compared to Sona's Q or her old starcall.

Makes me wonder who will become meta now? Thresh will stay as is(as per usual), but who will take her place?
lmao what if anything this INCREASES her sustain ability

You people aren't really good with numbers, are you? So many of you think this is a buff to her self-sustain. On live at rank 1 it is far better than on PBE at rank 5 - this is a complete destruction of a champion, not an attempt at balancing them. For comparison:

PBE rank 5 value: 90 + 10% AP over 5 seconds.
Live rank 1 value: 25 + 40% AP - 50 + 80% AP instantly, for each champion hit.

FIrst of all, that's between 30-70% AP lost. Sadly, Soraka isn't Riven or Yasuo and as such she isn't entitled for several smaller nerfs until they hit the sweet spot, instead opting for something like this that is by itself one of the biggest nerfs in theh istory of League. But oh boy, have we just started.

It doesn't stack from multiple people. As obvious from above, hitting two people at current rank 1 gives better healing than PBE rank 5.
It is a HoT over 5 seconds, applied by a spell whose cooldown after CDR will be 3.8 seconds and transferred by a heal whose cooldown is 1.2 seconds. Which means that you'll never get full value out of it. You are happy if you get 1/5 of what you get currently.
Spell that applies it got its AoE nerfed on PBE, and its range nerfed in one of recent patches. So good luck hitting that reliably on someone.

Soraka is dead with these changes. Her self sustain is as good as removed, so she needs to have Warmog and 3000+ HP by the time teamfights start or it is going to be a 4v5. That's a very unlikely scenario on a support budget - except she can't work in solo lane too, because she lost range, area and damage on her main ability there.

HER sustain, but her ability to support is lowered. Sure with "Alignment" she can give MP and HP back but she must 1. Hit an enemy with her Q and 2. Heal and ally. That's 150 MP and 10% of her current HP just to give an ally a little bit of mana and a little more healing than she currently does.

I think this is a very eloquent resolution to the current issues with playing against a Soraka in the lane phase. On live her heal is simply too efficient. Early game she is healing allies for close to %20 of their total hp at a very negligible health cost. She is allowed to simply sit back behind her adc, out of range of both opposing players. Without a very long range lane (Cait, blitz, etc.)  the opposing team doesn't even really interact with Soraka. This is the big issue I have with her current design. The PBE design directly improves this interaction. Soraka has to make a real decision. If she heals her ally she pays with health that she can't instantly recover. This creates a window of opportunity for the opposing laners. I love the design for Soraka to be the elite league of legends healer but it can't be at the cost of player interaction.

This doesn't fix her laning at all. She can still press W over and over again sitting behind her ADC. She is more likely to be able to wait 5 seconds in lane to get her "sustain."

This doesn't stop anyone from chugging potions and getting the healing from ancient coin.

What it does do though, is make her useless outside of lane and in teamfights.

She can  use W repeatedly but unlike on live the period in which she is punished for healing is much larger. Also if they are chugging potions more frequently they will have to back more frequently as well. Less time in lane is a benefit to the opposing team. In her current state she is very difficult to force out of lane because her sustain from her kit is too high/safe. Adding a window of decreased safety is increasing decision making. A healthy support should be balanced around their decision making opportunities. If you are playing Leona for example, you have to decide wether you commit to an all in engage or if you want to sit back and peel. Once you zenith blade in you have a long walk back to your carry if you have to peel. In her current state Soraka doesn't have these decisions to make ( at least not in lane). Did the adc take damage? Yes. Then heal. Deciding whether to lose the health to heal your ally should be impactful and right now it isn't. 

As far as making her useless later in game I think that might be a bit hyperbolic. It does make her gameplay more complex and it will take some adjustment but I think it will be great. Learning when to use starcall during the mid and late game will separate the good Soraka players from the bad ones.

I don't think you understand - _I rarely have to use Q in lane_ even now. In fact, I'm pretty sure I could go into lane, not even put a point into Q, and STILL do well. The only time I use Q is during an engage (ex. Leona Es onto the ADC and I am about 400 units away from her). I can tell you what I'm NOT doing in lane, and that is going up to 800 range to a Leona to throw a Q out.

These changes do not change anything about that. The 3 potions and ancient coin provide a lot of sustain for Soraka in lane, which makes her safe. Changing her W and Q like this and expecting lane Soraka to be nerfed is kind of silly.

And these changes DO make her role heavily limited in fights. Notice how you said "Learning when to use starcall during the mid and late game will separate the good Soraka players from the bad ones."

 But, there is no good time. Regardless of whether I land the Q or not, I'm not going to be regaining any health if I'm actually doing the job Soraka was designed to do, so why would I land a bunch of Qs that don't stack. This transfer doesn't work when the CD of Starcall is 5 seconds alone at max rank, so any sort of CDR means if I am spamming Q off CD (like these chages "want" Soraka to do, which is be more interactive) I am not even being rewarded extra healing because the BUFF DURATION is still 5 seconds. DOn't even get me started on how W has a 1.2 sec CD.

It just doesn't work, the numbers are WAY off, and the idea of being punished for doing the job you picked Soraka for feels terrible.

It's almost like if Vlad couldn't cast his Ult or his E for 5 seconds if he wanted healing from his Q.

Knowing how to use Starcall effectively was a major hallmark that separated good sorakas from bad ones though. The new system is going to negate any self healing she'd get in teamfights though since she loses her self-sustain the moment she heals an ally. and its not like she can always "wait the 5 seconds" to heal someone so that she gets the full effect out of alignment

I agree that a benefit of the change is that raka's heal will be a little more costly, so you have to be (supposedly) smarter about using it. However what you don't understand is that besides fewer total heals, raka will not actually lose out on saftey, rather the fact that she gets the full benefit from hitting a single target on a now easier to hit Q, combined with the fact that she no longer has to manage her mana as often (Q costs less, gives mana) means these changes encourage a mainly backlining soraka. Because of the "window of opportunity" the five second heal provides, engage comps will counter raka mid and late game, but that's at the cost of making poke comps with raka stronger and her laning even more obnoxious than people currently perceive it. Nobodies asking for no change, this one just forces raka players into a more passive, boring game. The right answer would have been to force raka to come closer to the enemy for her sustain, which is what riot initially tried to do with the shorter Q range. They should make the heals act like thresh souls in my opinion, that way Raka would be rewarded for active participation in fights, that's when she's most vulnerable not when she's sitting pretty in the backline, twiddling her thumbs for five seconds.
gutting her self heal and aoe range does seem like a pretty heavy gutting knife on her. Hopefully they comp the heals back in some way.
I will miss my lamb she is my second most played champion

What bothers me isn't how bad the her self sustain is now, cause you know...counterplay, but seriously with this change her W+Q heal will heal less on her target in total than live soraka while also having a chunk of the heal be overtime. She won't heal even to more health till both q and w are maxed and even then only one person she heals gets the q heal and even if it heals slightly more its over time. How is she supposed to be leagues best healer when her heal is worse than say nami's and she is punished for using it. I find Soraka as obnoxious as the next guy but this doesn't seem fair to soraka at all. Maybe there is something to these changes that makes it work but it looks horrid on paper. 

PS Why do some champs seem to get a patch by patch gentle touch while others get these nuclear option changes with the promise "we may get back to it if it turns out to suck".
That is a very good question, I wish a red would actually let me share some feedback regarding the changes, but unfortunately I will just go unheard again and be forced to swallow this bitter pill.

Soraka is one of the few champs I've mastered, and let me say that the compensation for her is actually pretty nice, and it's interesting that she's able to give mana to allies again. Besides, if we're being perfectly honest the only time we'd need to heal minions would be with banner of command minions or baron buffed siege minions, Raka not being able to heal minions is almost a buff since you can't misclick on a minion when trying to save your carry anymore.

Remember when Soraka's rework got released? If you go back and look at that post there are a lot of comments that talk about how garbage she'd be, yet here we are. Things often work out differently in practice than on paper. These nerfs aren't actually as bad as they look on paper, and I for one am still going to play the Banana lady and show off my mastery every time I do something stupid with her.

I appreciate the optimism. I don't actually think this is a nerf to raka overall, i think it is a massive nerf to raka's active playstyle (heal spamming at close quarters in teamfights and duels), and a relatively large buff to her passive playstyle (backline all day, wait to heal whoever comes back once with alignment, restore mana, occasionally sit out the fight for five seconds after hitting her now easier to hit q that doesn't ask you to hit multiple enemies to get its full benefit), and arguably her laning (since it takes less skill to hit q and gain it's full benefit, as well the mana buff). I value the active playstyle more though, and think it's healthier for the game.

I think this will make raka too strong in poke comps, and useless against engage comps. I think that the people who loved raka are going to miss out on some of the funnest moments offered by her old Q, while raka haters are going to be confused that raka has somehow become more annoying.

Anyhow, new kit means rushing cdr and zhonyas (since it works well with the delayed self heal in sticky situations) every game, then finishing off with a warmogs as the second to last item. If it decreases confusion i'm for it, but i think she should be buffed as compensation, which i guess she was though i don't know if it's enough.

Interactive raka's will be dead raka's, dead raka's with shitty heals cuz they built tank because with these changes obviously. Also, hitting minions or getting heals from multiple champs was fun. This is the reason why I played her so much. Deciding to use her heal to save someone or use the armor buff....good times. It would be easier to balance if her heal was part heal and buff again, or maybe it could have a different effect if over healing allies like turning into a damage buff or shield.

the changes to soraka don't seem that bad.

but an that 4th stack of drag is hot now

Congratulations Riot you have officially and successfully made a champion more useless then a caster minion. Can I get a red to delete my soraka 5 mastery I don't want to be reminded every time I open my profile of what you have done to her.

Between the nerfs, rework, and new nerfs to {{champion:16}}, Riot is really getting my goat.

But, bad jokes aside, people complained the pre-rework Soraka, whose kit was about long-term healing and extended team fights, was cancer and anti-fun, so she was nerfed and subsequently reworked her into her current burst heal/poke kit that people still complain is cancer and anti-fun, bringing about this new round of nerfs. But if Soraka is going to be called cancer and anti-fun regardless, why can't we have her previous kit restored?

By the way, calling something cancer and anti-fun does not make a real statement about any champion, but reveals something about the player who can't figure out that champion's weaknesses, or just stubbornly picks a champion into something that counters it, gets outplayed, then begs for the winning champion to be crippled rather than adapting or acknowledging the outplay. Because, at its core, losing is anti-fun, this is only half the story, as the winner had fun, so fun and anti-fun cancel each other out, thus fun is not a valuable tool to gauge a champion's need for a nerf/rework.
